descriptions: PSMS 31 is a K-8 school that offers a comprehensive educational experience focusing on both academic learning and social-emotional development. The school serves students in 3K, 4K, and K-8 grades. PSMS 31 follows a holistic approach to education, aiming to nurture well-rounded individuals who are prepared to succeed in both academics and interpersonal skills.  Aligned with District 7's vision of being the bridge to generational success, PSMS 31 is committed to providing innovative and transformational opportunities to its students. The school offers accelerated courses in subjects such as Algebra, Living Environment, and US History Regents, allowing students to excel academically.  In addition to traditional academic subjects, PSMS 31 provides a variety of extracurricular programs to enrich the students' educational experience. These programs include the Broadway Jr Theater program, financial literacy, West African drums and dance, modern dance, band, debate club, My Brother and Sisters Keeper, hydroponics, coding, and virtual reality.  Furthermore, PSMS 31 collaborates with community-based organizations to offer additional activities such as cooking, painting, dance, basketball, volleyball, and step. The school believes that every lesson is an experience and strives to provide a learning environment that empowers students to become active and engaged citizens who can excel and lead in their communities and beyond.  Overall, PSMS 31 aims to provide a well-rounded education that prepares students not only for academic success but also for personal growth and leadership roles in their communities.

The NYC School Survey is administered every year to students in grades 6-12 and to families and teachers of children in grades K-12. The survey is designed to collect information about each school's ability to support student success.

Response rates show what percentage of the school community actually completed the survey. Higher response rates tell us that the results of the survey reflect the views of a larger portion of the group surveyed.
